sample.content:
The matter was different than any incident they had seen before. Changing the legality of the issue would resolve it. The present set of rules made it hard to arrive at a conclusion. However the administration was in dilemma to create a new rule given the rare chance of having this incident occur again.
1. Once bitten, twice shy
2. A man who is his own lawyer has a fool for his client
3. Practice what you preach
4. It takes two to tango
5. Success has many fathers, while failure is an orphan
6. A stitch in time saves nine
7. A house divided against itself cannot stand
8. Hard cases make bad law
9. He who hesitates is lost
10. For want of a nail the shoe was lost; for want of a shoe the horse was lost; and for want of a horse the man was lost
sample.name: example_user

sample.content:
The painting was beautiful just as it was and he was very proud of it. The colour, the scene, the execution - all were very definitely the best work he had ever done. He could not help, though, wanting to make it even better and he made some additions, after a couple of glasses of celebratory wine. In the morning he realised that he had totally overdone it and that his painting was ruined. He should have left it as it was.
1. Silence is golden
2. Hindsight is always twenty-twenty
3. Fish always stink from the head down
4. From the sublime to the ridiculous is only one step
5. Life is what you make it
6. God helps those who help themselves
7. There's no accounting for tastes
8. Distance lends enchantment to the view
9. Little things please little minds
10. Never judge a book by its cover
sample.name: example_user

sample.content:
Doug was not a good golfer. In an attempt to improve his game, he went to the golf shop and bought a new putter. After a miserable day on the golf course, he returned the putter to the shop and stated it was defective and made his putting worse. Although no one had ever complained about the putter before, the manager of the golf shop stated Doug was right and refunded his money.
1. For want of a nail the shoe was lost; for want of a shoe the horse was lost; and for want of a horse the man was lost
2. The customer is always right
3. To err is human; to forgive divine
4. A stitch in time saves nine
5. Honey catches more flies than vinegar
6. Give credit where credit is due
7. Haste makes waste
8. The cobbler always wears the worst shoes
9. Cleanliness is next to godliness
10. A poor workman always blames his tools
sample.name: example_user

sample.content:
Cody just got his driver's permit and asked his dad to borrow the car. His dad was hesitant but said yes. That night, Cody crashed the car into a tree and the car was wrecked. Cody was afraid to tell his dad, but he mustered up the courage. His dad was furious and yelled at him. Cody was apologetic and took full responsibility. Cody's dad relented a bit and was happy Cody was not hurt.
1. A man who is his own lawyer has a fool for his client
2. The apple never falls far from the tree
3. You can't hold with the hare and run with the hounds
4. A soft answer turneth away wrath
5. For want of a nail the shoe was lost; for want of a shoe the horse was lost; and for want of a horse the man was lost
6. The wages of sin is death
7. To err is human; to forgive divine
8. The customer is always right
9. It takes two to tango
10. If the mountain won't come to Mohammed, then Mohammed must go to the mountain
sample.name: example_user
